Title: How to Start Trading in 2026: Setup, Risk & Common Mistakes
Description:
In 2026, the right way to start trading isnâ€™t chasing tipsâ€”itâ€™s understanding your edge and building strong risk management.
In this video, we break down what an edge actually means and how to measure it using expectancy (win rate, average win, and average loss).
Youâ€™ll learn how to audit your last 3 months of trades to see whether your approach is profitableâ€”or just gambling.
We also explain the two real ways traders make money: capturing market inefficiencies or getting paid for taking risk (intraday vs overnight concept).
Finally, we share a simple 15% drawdown framework to size positions and survive normal losing streaks without blowing up your account.
If you want a clear beginner roadmap for trading in 2026, this video is your step-by-step starting point.

0:00 - Introduction
0:40 - What is Edge & How to Calculate It
3:40 - Two Ways to Build an Edge
7:14 - Why Most Traders Fail (Risk Management)
8:38 - Position Sizing: The 15% Rule
10:16 - Final Takeaway

Title: 20 years of option trading wisdom  in 50 minutes | ft Raghav malik and Praful Kulkarni
Description:
In this episode of Breakfast with Traders, Praful Kulkarni interviews Raghav Malik, founder of AlgoTest, about systematic options trading.
Raghav shares lessons from trading volatility during the 2008 financial crisis, explains the concept of volatility risk premium, and breaks down why backtesting can fail during regime shifts. 
He debunks the myth of "risk-free" options selling, explains implied vs realized volatility, and emphasizes the importance of understanding the "language of options" before trading.

Timestamps:
0:00 - Highlights and Introduction
3:42 - Trading During 2008 Financial Crisis & Lessons Learned
9:18 - Two Ways to Make Money: Inefficiency vs Risk Premium
13:52 - Why Backtesting Failed in 2008 & Regime Shifts
22:08 - Risk Management for Retail Options Traders
25:13 - Common Misconception: Theta Decay vs Volatility Crush
29:33 - Implied Volatility vs Realized Volatility Explained
31:57 - The "Risk-Free" Options Selling Myth
34:15 - Negative Skew Strategies & Tail Risk
40:02 - 9:20 Strategy Breakdown
42:06 - Building Strategies: From Market Observation to Backtesting
46:43 - Avoiding Curve Fitting: Idea-First Approach

Title: Women in Trading: Algo vs Discretionary
Description:
In this exclusive Stock Market India podcast, we dive deep into the ultimate trading debate: Algo Trading vs. Manual Trading. Join us as we uncover which trading strategy is best suited for conquering the Nifty 50 and managing volatility in the Indian market.

Host Vishal sits down with two expert traders, Shikha and Prachi, to compare their distinct approaches to the Share Market. Shikha reveals how automation helps her manage emotions and scale capital efficiently, while Prachi explains the power of discretionary trading using Price Action and Option Chain analysis.

What you will learn in this episode:

Intraday Trading secrets: Time-based strategies (like the 9:20 Straddle) vs. reading data.

How to manage risk with the "1% Rule" and handle market drawdowns.

The psychology behind scaling your capital from 1 Cr to 100 Cr.

The reality of being a woman in the male-dominated trading industry.

Whether you are a beginner or an experienced trader, the insights on Option Decay and Trading Psychology discussed here are worth researching to refine your own setup.

Title: Ex market maker breaks myths about market manipulation ?
Description:
Ever wondered who's on the other side of your trades? This Off the Charts episode takes you inside the world of market makers and HFT firms. Shreyans Jain, who spent 8 years at one of India's top prop trading firms, reveals how market makers keep spreads tight, manage massive positions, and profit in microseconds. From delta-neutral strategies to the Jane Street scandal, we decode the engine room of Indian markets.

Title: When should you buy options?
Description:
Are you confused about when to buy options vs. sell options? In this video, we dive into the world of volatility trading using the powerful concepts of India VIX, Implied Volatility (IV), and Historical Volatility (HV).

Most traders get the correlation wrong! We clarify the myth: Does a high VIX mean the market will fall? (Spoiler: Not always!)

What you will learn in this video:

India VIX Explained: Definition, calculation, and what a VIX value of 12 means for the Nifty's expected 30-day movement.

IV vs. HV (Implied Volatility vs. Historical Volatility): Learn the key difference and how to use the relationship between them to determine if premiums are high or low.

Volatility Mean Reversion Strategy: Why volatility always tends to return to its average, and how you can profit from this phenomenon.

The Strategy (IV is High): When should you use Option Selling (Short Straddle or Short Strangle)? 

Risk Management: Essential tips for using Stop Losses and hedging strategies like the Iron Condor.

Title: Can AI make you a better trader?

How is AI really being used in financial markets? We asked a pro to show us.

Welcome to Episode 2 of Off the Charts! In this episode, Vaibhav Jain sits down with Souvik Das, a former banker turned full-time systematic trader, for a masterclass on automated trading. Souvik doesn't just talk about AIâ€”he shares his screen and shows you exactly how he uses it in live market hours.

In this episode, you will see:

AI's Real-World Impact: How AI is fundamentally changing trading and the financial markets.

Automated News Signals: A look inside his n8n server that tracks global news 24/7 to generate actionable trading signals.
The Future of Finance: Souvik and Vaibhav discuss what's next for AI in the world of trading and investing.

This is a rare, practical look inside the toolkit of a modern systematic trader. If you're interested in AI in trading, algorithmic trading, or portfolio optimization, this is a must-watch.

Title: Volatility breakout strategy for beginners in trading
Description:
In this video, Algo trader Aseem Singhal explains a simple volatility-based trading concept that was backtested.

Core Idea (Backtested):

If todayâ€™s volatility is greater than the past 14 days, then buy on a green candle or sell on a red candle, and exit at the next dayâ€™s open.

What we cover:

Cumulative PnL / equity curve
PnL distribution by trade type (long vs short)
Monthly drawdown analysis & recovery
Volatility â†” Profitability: does higher vol translate to better returns?

Title: What backtesting tells about chart patterns
Description:
In this video, we explore whether market candles are truly independent of prior candles.  

If you flip a coin and get five heads in a row, does that change the probability of the next flip being heads or tails? 

With this context in mind, we look at the Nifty, which has just formed seven consecutive red candles. 

Does this increase the chance of a green candle next, or are market moves independent events? To answer this, we present backtested data and reveal what history really tells us.

Title: How the 'Big Money' Really Trades the Market | Off the Charts Episode 1
Description:
Welcome to the first episode of 'Off the Charts', a series that looks at trading in its entirety. Weâ€™ll dive into the forces, ideas, and stories that shape markets, unpack the complexities, and explore what it truly means to trade in a world that never stops changing. 

Meet Vaibhav Jain, your host for this seires. Vaibhav is a CFA and CMT charterholder and an MBA graduate from IIM Indore. With prior experience as an Investment Banker at Deutsche Bank and over a decade of personal trading experience, he brings a unique blend of professional and practical market insights to every conversation.

In this episode, Vaibhav sits down with Manan Vaishnav, Head of Societe Generale Securities India, for an in-depth discussion on the world of institutional sales trading.

Together, they dive deep into the world of institutional sales trading â€” exploring how the biggest players in the markets operate, how trades are placed, and what really happens behind the scenes at the trading desk. From block trades and crossing mechanisms to understanding the different approaches various market players take, this episode is packed with insights.

Youâ€™ll also learn how institutions manage risk, what happens during index and ETF rebalancing days, and what skills and mindset are needed to succeed in this high-pressure profession. Manan also shares his personal journey into the world of institutional trading and what aspiring professionals should focus on.

Title: Beginnerâ€™s Guide to Systematic Trading (2025) | Learn Algorithmic Trading with Rakesh Pujara
Description:
If youâ€™ve ever wondered how professional traders actually approach the markets, this video is for you. In this conversation, seasoned trader Rakesh Pujara walks us through the world of systematic trading â€” starting from the basics and gradually building up to more advanced ideas.
We begin with the role of algorithms in trading, then move into practical concepts like backtesting, expectancy, and Monte Carlo simulations to make your strategies more robust. Rakesh also explains why trying to time the market rarely works, and how instead you can apply algorithms to make decisions in a more disciplined way.
From there, we dive into trading strategies, the four pillars of returns, and why diversification and non-correlation matter. Risk management is another big part of the discussion â€” with insights on leverage, hedging, and how to put everything together into a complete trading framework.
By the end, youâ€™ll have a clear picture of how systematic trading works and what it takes to start thinking like a process-driven trader. Whether youâ€™re completely new or already exploring algorithmic trading, this session will give you practical takeaways to use on your journey.

Title: What They're Not Telling You About Option Trading Risks
Description:
In this episode, Raghav Malik shares how institutions truly approach options trading. He breaks down what the real edge in trading is, and why luck may help in the short term, but only skill ensures success in the long run.

Raghav emphasizes that retail traders should stop thinking of options as simple directional bets, and instead view them as predictions on volatility. He dives deep into the difference between implied volatility (IV) and realized volatility (RV) â€” and explains why these two factors ultimately decide an options traderâ€™s profit or loss over time.

Through practical examples and backtested data, he introduces the concept of the Volatility Risk Premium (VRP). Raghav shows how it has historically played out in markets, why itâ€™s not â€œfree money,â€ and why risk management is critical to harvesting VRP effectively.

If you want to understand how professionals think about options, volatility, and risk â€” this episode is packed with insights you wonâ€™t want to miss.

Title: Index options arbitrage trading strategy | What is box strategy in trading?
Description:
In this video, Aseem explains the Box Strategy â€” an arbitrage trading approach that combines two option spreads: a bull call spread and a bear put spread. This strategy helps traders capture pricing mismatches, and if executed at the right entry points, it can deliver risk-free, guaranteed profits.
Aseem also breaks down the practical challenges traders face when implementing the Box Strategy, such as:

The difficulty of manually spotting and executing the trades
High transaction costs that can reduce or even wipe out profits

Through a step-by-step example, viewers will gain a clear understanding of how the Box Strategy works, when it can be effective, and the limitations to keep in mind.

Title: How to use Price Action for Intraday Trading?
Description:
In this episode of Trading ki Baat, host Arjun Tandon is joined by expert trader Kaushhik Maall for a deep dive into price action and level based trading strategies â€” using a real-world case from mid-2024, when SEBI raised concerns over alleged manipulation in Bank Nifty by Jane Street.

Start with the daily chart to frame the setup

Using trailing stop losses and dynamic exit points

Title: Should you Predict the Market for Intraday Trading?
Description:
In this video, seasoned trader Arjun Tandon introduces the concept of time-based straddlesâ€”a systematic approach to trading where decisions are made based on fixed rules rather than guesses or predictions. Learn how entering trades at specific times like 9:20 AM or 9:30 AM, combined with predefined stop-loss levels such as 20%, 30%, or even 100%, can help manage risk and optimize outcomes.

Arjun presents historical data demonstrating the potential payoffs of such strategies and explains how traders can customize them by setting profit targets, trailing stop-losses, or identifying rule-based re-entry points. This methodical approach encourages discipline and reduces emotional decision-making.

If youâ€™re new to trading and looking for a structured way to start with straddles, this video is a must-watch. Get ready to build a solid foundation for your systematic trading journey.

Hosted by Praful Kulkarni, a mechanical engineer from NIT Surathkal who left his central government job in 2019 to pursue full-time trading, this series brings you authentic conversations with Indiaâ€™s trading experts.

In this second episode, we feature Harish Sharma, an experienced index options trader since 2011. Harishâ€™s journey is truly inspiring â€” starting from a humble background, he faced several losses in his initial years but never gave up. Through dedication and learning, he mastered the art of trading and eventually earned crores in profits.

Title: How to Sell Options Like a Hedge Fund | Options Trading for beginners
Description:
How to Sell Options Like a Hedge Fund | Options Trading for beginners

Discover how Tanmay Kurtkoti simplifies systematic trading for beginners in this insightful video. Tanmay dissects option trading, urging viewers not to label themselves strictly as â€œoption buyersâ€ or â€œoption sellers,â€ but to become adaptable option traders. He explains why market conditionsâ€”not personal biasâ€”should guide your approach.

Tanmay shines a light on common pitfalls for new traders, including the dangers of trying to profit solely from options' time decay or attempting to outguess the market. He emphasizes that lasting success requires reacting thoughtfully to evolving market conditions, not gambling on predictions or trading on widely known information with no real edge.

In this video, Tanmay shares a straightforward calendar spread strategy thatâ€™s easy to implement, guided by clear, systematic rules that anyone can followâ€”no coding required. He demonstrates how to adapt and adjust calendar spreads as market conditions shift, enabling traders to build consistency and repeatability into their returns.

Packed with practical wisdom and straightforward explanations, this video is a must-watch for anyone eager to start systematic trading or those looking to see complex trading topics made easy and accessible by an expert.

Title: Ultimate Guide to start trading in 2025 | Trading for beginners
Description:
Welcome to Groww Ki Pathshala â€“ Episode 1, a beginner-friendly trading masterclass featuring Chetan Panchamia, where the fundamentals of financial markets are broken down in a simple and easy-to-understand way. Whether you are just starting your trading journey or want to solidify your basic knowledge, this first episode in the series covers essential concepts that will set you on the path to confident trading.

In this episode, Chetan explains what a market is and how it functions, giving you an understanding of how trades happen behind the scenes. He also clarifies bid and ask prices, helping you grasp their critical role in day-to-day trading. You will get a thorough introduction to technical analysis and learn how it differs from fundamental analysis.

Additionally, the video dives into the different types of market trends â€“ uptrend, downtrend, and range-bound markets â€“ along with the assumptions that underpin technical analysis. Chetan also highlights the powerful influence of human emotions such as fear, greed, and hope on trading decisions.

Specifically designed for beginners, Groww Ki Pathshala makes complex trading concepts accessible and practical, providing a strong foundation for anyone looking to start investing or improve their trading mindset.

Title: What were the strategies that got Jane Street banned?
Description:
In this video, Aseem Singhal breaks down the trading strategy that led to SEBI banning Jane Street from the Indian markets. He provides an in-depth analysis of the SEBI report, revealing how Jane Street manipulated the markets by buying underlying stocks and taking reverse positions in options. Whether you're a retail trader impacted by these market spikes or simply curious about how this unfolded, this video is a must-watch for anyone seeking clarity on the situation.

Title: How to backtest MACD strategy the right way? Ft. Aseem Singhal
Description:
In this MACD trading masterclass, weâ€™ll take you through the best way to master MACD (Moving Average Convergence Divergence) for successful trading. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced trader, this video will help you understand the power of MACD in identifying trends, spotting potential buy/sell signals, and enhancing your technical analysis.

The MACD indicator is one of the most popular tools used by traders to analyze price movements and trends in the stock market. In this MACD trading masterclass, weâ€™ll dive into everything you need to know about the MACD strategy, including how to effectively use it for timing entries and exits, spotting bullish and bearish trends, and understanding the importance of MACD crossovers.

01:00 - Why Weâ€™re Here
01:42 - Game Plan: Testing MACD strategies on Indian stocks.
02:26 - MACD 101: Momentum indicator decoded (12, 26, 9).

04:45 - Pick Your Tool: Why traders choose MACD.
07:23 - Is MACD Legit?: Aseemâ€™s tests on stocks & indices.
08:20 - The Source: SSRN paper fueling our MACD dive.

20:45 - Strategy #2 Results: Profitable but shaky consistency.

26:48 - Strategy #3 Results: Solid but bruised by 2020 crash.
29:29 - Strategy #4: Signal Crossover Above Zero â€“ trend-chasing gold.
33:34 - Strategy #4 Hack: Crush it on 5-min/15-min charts.
35:07 - Level Up: Add price action, stop losses to MACD.
36:28 - MACD in 2025?: Still a champ with fresh data.
37:38 - Newbie Tips: Paper trade, set stops, aim for targets.
40:13 - Why White Papers?: Fresh ideas, worth the grind.
42:17 - Wrap-Up: Long trades shine, shorts need work.

If youâ€™ve been looking to refine your trading strategies and unlock the full potential of the MACD indicator, this masterclass is perfect for you! Weâ€™ll break it down step by step so you can confidently apply MACD to your trading setups.

If you've been struggling to predict market direction, this strategy will help you understand how to approach trading when the market moves in uncertain directions.

We discuss the Long Straddle strategy, where you buy both a call and put option at the same strike price and expiration. This strategy ensures limited risk and can be used in various market conditions. Watch till the end to learn how and when to implement this strategy, along with some important points to consider for its effective use.

This strategy is often applied before major market events or earnings announcements, where the direction of the stock is uncertain. Additionally, mid-cap stocks are discussed in relation to their volatility, which may present different opportunities in trading.

Please note that this video is for educational purposes only, and there is no guarantee of profits. Always conduct your own research and consider all risks before applying any trading strategies.

Let us know your thoughts in the comments and stay tuned for more trading insights in future videos.

Title: How Vivek Bajaj Built a Trading Empire | Breakfast with Traders
Description:
In Episode 10 of Breakfast with Traders, host Praful Kulkarni engages in a compelling conversation with Vivek Bajaj, a seasoned trader and co-founder of StockEdge and Elearnmarkets. 

With over 20 years of experience in equities, options, currencies, and commodities, Vivek shares his insights on regulatory changes, his personal trading journey, momentum investing strategies, and his mission to empower individuals through financial education. 

Discover how he leverages data analytics and technology to simplify market complexities for retail investors.

Title: How To Trade A Bear Market To Make Big Profits: The Secrets of Trading
Description:
How To Trade A Bear Market To Make Big Profits: The Secrets of Trading

This video will show you the secrets to trading in the bear market. You see, bear markets are actually a good time period to trade  - it's just not what most people think. In fact, it's quite the opposite! We will cover all the details of trading during a bear market and how you can use that to make good trades.

In this video:
0:00 Introduction
1:14 Aseem Singhal's introduction
3:18 What percentage fall qualifies to be called a bear market? 
5:55 Analysis of previous bear markets
10:00 Aseem's definition of a bear market
13:12 When does a bear market end?

The Untold Secret of Ichimoku Trading: All You Need To Know About Trading With a Cloud For Success

Ichimoku is a Japanese technical trading system that is heavily based on the use of price action and momentum. Ichimoku is a very powerful trading strategy that is often overlooked by traders because it looks complicated to trade with. We are going to show you everything about Ichimoku including how to trade with it, what are its strengths, what are its weaknesses and why you should trade with it.
